title: How to read books on my Kindle - Quora

response.answer_text: You can purchase books in Kindle version from Amazon. You let your Amazon account know you have a Kindle, then the books will be downloaded to your Kindle. There are also some online sources of free books in e-book format (mostly older stuff, but lots of classics). Getting them into your Kindle isn’t quite as direct, but you can probably figure it out with info from the source sites. I have downloaded them to my computer, then connected my Kindle to the computer via USB. The computer sees the Kindle like an external drive, and you can copy/paste the free books onto the Kindle.

is easier to do request the book or check out the book using your computer then you can sync and read the book in your kindle. my suggestion for you is go to your closer library, that way you can read the books and also do it for free and they can teach you how to do it if you request 1–1 appointment with a librarian.
